title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
summary: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS) is a rare[5][6] but life-threatening reaction that can occur in response to neuroleptic or antipsychotic medication.[1] Symptoms include high fever, confusion, rigid muscles, variable blood pressure, sweating, and fast heart rate.[1] Complications may include rhabdomyolysis, high blood potassium, kidney failure, or seizures.[1][2]
